details.content:
supabase table creation
as described in schema
tables for category 2, 3, 4 and associated flow

description.content: supabase table creation for category 1 and user profile
create user profile screen and link to the profile screen manage profile button

details.content:
Flow:
User #T1
user_id (PK)
name
email
password_hash
created_at

Categories #T2
category_id (PK)
category_name
description

Example rows:
1 → Patent Search
2 → Trademark Filing
3 → Copyright Registration

Services #T3
service_id (PK)
category_id (FK → categories.category_id)
service_name
description
price
estimated_time

Example rows (linked to Patent Search category):
1 → Service 1
2 → Service 2
3 → Service 3

Options #T4
selection_id (PK)
Option 1
Option 2
Option 3

Service Form Data #T5
form_id (PK)
selection_id (FK → selections.selection_id)
field_name
field_value

Here, each form entry is stored as field_name → field_value. This lets you handle different fields for different services without changing the table structure.

Payments #T5
payment_id (PK)
user_id (FK → users.user_id)
selection_id (FK → selections.selection_id)
amount
payment_date
payment_status

create master form with all labels and fields
provide buttons and display data for each category and service
